args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . Trump signs executive order to create crypto council, reduce regulation President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order that aims to ease regulation on cryptocurrency, seeking to fulfill the policy promises he made to the industry after courting its cash and support throughout the 2024 campaign. The new directive established a working group to advise Trump on crypto policy, including the possible creation of a national reserve of bitcoin or other tokens. It also tasked federal agencies to review their rules, while revoking an order issued under President Joe Biden designed to improve safeguards on the financial technology. Trump signed the executive order just days after he widely promoted a new cryptocurrency project that quickly soared in value, potentially generating billions of dollars, in a move that sparked fresh concerns about his commingling of public office and personal business. In a radical departure from his first term, Trump last year began to align himself with the nation’s crypto elite, who eagerly backed his candidacy in a bid to secure a more favorable regulatory environment in Washington. Appearing at a bitcoin conference in Nashville, Trump even promised to turn the United States into the “crypto capital of the planet,” particularly by pursuing policy “written by people who love your industry.” After he won the White House, the president sought advice from crypto investors including Marc Andreessen, and he tapped fellow Silicon Valley venture capitalist David Sacks to help guide crypto policy in the administration. Trump also nominated Paul Atkins, a veteran regulator who has consulted for crypto firms, to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission.
